 Schedule for providing a vehicle and equipment list and route summary to the Contract Manager and ensuring that all vehicles are street legal (registered, insured, licensed, and tagged) prior to the Commencement Date. 
 Schedule for delivering the FRANCHISEE-provided information brochure to all customers (existing & new) prior to the Commencement Date, subject to approval by the City Manager. 
 Schedule for conducting dry-runs of collection routes. 
 FRANCHISEE will develop a multi-faceted media and communications plan featuring the CITY- approved mailers, community events, Internet updates, media outreach, and phone calls to provide information about new services to customers. All education and outreach materials and information shall be reviewed and approved by the CITY prior to dissemination. 
 FRANCHISEE will prepare and distribute the CITY-approved educational and outreach materials to all CITY residents including service days, proper recycling methods, and the local phone number for FRANCHISEE's customer service center. 
 FRANCHISEE will provide direct access to professional staff to address questions and concerns. 
 Residents will: 
º Receive comprehensive information on Roll Carts, including size options. 
º Have full access to a FRANCHISEE-based team of transition experts who can answer questions and assist residents on choosing the Roll Cart size that best meets their needs. 
º Have access to a customer service professional before, during, and after business hours that can answer questions about Roll Carts or transition, process requests for a different Roll Cart size, schedule deliveries, and provide answers on proper recycling. 
5.2. Solid Waste Service Contracts 
    5.2.1. Any and all contracts that provide Solid Waste collection service and/or related Solid Waste services between the previous franchisees and Residential or Commercial Customers within the Franchise Area shall be null and void as of 11:59 p.m. on September 30, 2016. 
    5.2.2. The term of any contract for Solid Waste collection shall not extend past the term of this Agreement, except as provided for in Section 5.3.1. 
5.3 Transition Prior to Expiration of Collection Services 
    5.3.1. Should the CITY choose not to renew this Agreement or should no renewal options remain, the CITY anticipates awarding a new agreement at least six (6) months prior to the expiration of this Agreement or any subsequent renewals. In the event a new agreement has not been awarded within such time frame, FRANCHISEE agrees to provide service to the CITY for an additional ninety (90) Day period beyond the expiration of the Agreement at the then established service rates, provided the CITY requests said services in writing pursuant to Section 21.16, at such time. 
    5.3.2. At the expiration of this Agreement, FRANCHISEE shall work with the CITY and the newly selected franchisee to ensure a smooth transition period with no interruption of service, including, but not limited to, attending coordination meetings with the CITY and newly selected franchisee, coordination and cooperation in delivery and removal of residential and commercial containers, and providing service information, as requested. 
    5.3.3. The CITY reserves the right to withhold payment to FRANCHISEE for the final month of service until FRANCHISEE has complied with all requirements of this Article[Section]. 
SECTION 6. - RESIDENTIAL SERVICE. 
6.1 FRANCHISEE shall collect and dispose of Solid Waste and Program Recyclables from the properties of Residential Customers within the Franchise Area pursuant to the terms and conditions of this Article[Section] 6. 
6.2 Service Request. Residential Units initiate, terminate, or change service for Solid Waste and Program Recycling collection service by contacting the CITY. The CITY shall notify FRANCHISEE in writing of the customer's request for Residential Collection Service. The Residential Collection Service by FRANCHISEE shall start, terminate, or change on the next scheduled collection date from the date notice of the requested service is provided to FRANCHISEE from CITY. FRANCHISEE will not initiate, terminate, or change service to the Residential Customer without written notification from the CITY. 
6.3 Residential Solid Waste Collection Service 
    6.3.1. FRANCHISEE shall collect Solid Waste from Residential Customers according to the provisions herein. 
    6.3.2. Solid Waste other than Special Waste. 
    6.3.2.1 FRANCHISEE shall collect Solid Waste other than Special Waste from Residential Customers utilizing Roll Cart Containers twice per week in accordance with the Collection Schedule. 
    6.3.2.2 Containers. Collection of Solid Waste other than Special Waste shall be in FRANCHISEE-provided Containers. FRANCHISEE shall provide Roll Carts to Residential Units. See Article[Section] 9 for further details regarding Containers, including Roll Carts for Solid Waste other than Special Waste. Residential Customers will be instructed to place all Solid Waste other than Special Waste inside of designated Containers. 
    6.3.3. Special Waste. Provided Special Waste is placed at the Collection Point pursuant to this Section, there shall be no additional charge to the customer or the CITY for collecting Bulk Trash, tires or Yard Trash generated by the Residential Customer, containerized or non-containerized, unless otherwise provided herein. 
    6.3.3.1 Bulk Trash. Oversized items of Bulk Trash consisting of white goods shall be collected by FRANCHISEE within two (2) business Days after receiving a request for white goods pick-up made by the Residential Customer or the CITY to the FRANCHISEE. Oversized items of Bulk Trash other than white goods, including furniture and other household goods, shall be collected by FRANCHISEE on the same day Yard Trash is collected in accordance with the Collection Schedule. 
    6.3.3.2 Waste Tires. FRANCHISEE shall collect up to a maximum of four (4) tires as Solid Waste from each Residential Unit per year. Collection shall be within two (2) business Days after receiving a request for pick-up of such materials made by the Residential Customer or the CITY to the FRANCHISEE. 
    6.3.3.3 Yard Trash. FRANCHISEE shall collect Yard Trash generated by the Residential Customer utilizing customer-provided Containers once per week in accordance with the Collection Schedule. See Article[Section] 9 for further details regarding Containers, including customer-provided Containers for Yard Trash. FRANCHISEE shall provide collection for non-containerized Yard Trash generated by the Residential Customer within five (5) business Days after receiving a request for non-containerized Yard Trash pick-up made by the Residential Customer or the CITY to the FRANCHISEE. If the Yard Trash is bagged, FRANCHISEE shall leave a notice on the bag instructing the customer that Yard Trash should not be placed in a bag. FRANCHISEE is not required to collect any tree cutting or stump that exceeds four (4) feet in length or three (3) inches in diameter or fifty (50) pounds in weight except that FRANCHISEE shall collect storm debris and natural Christmas trees (free from any lights, ornaments, etc.), provided that the sections of the tree do not exceed eight (8) feet in length or fifty (50) pounds in weight. Yard Trash generated by a commercial entity or generated in connection with land-clearing for development purposes is beyond the scope of this Agreement and FRANCHISEE is not required to collect Yard Trash generated by a commercial entity or generated in connection with land-clearing for development purposes. 
    6.3.3.4 Other Special Waste. This Agreement is not intended to require the FRANCHISEE to collect such other Special Waste material generated by Residential Customers, including biological waste, biomedical waste, construction and demolition debris, hazardous substance, hazardous waste, and sludge, as such terms are defined by § 403.703, Fla. Statute. Notwithstanding the foregoing, FRANCHISEE understands and agrees to collect as part of its regular Residential Solid Waste Collection Service that small amount of containerized construction and demolition debris resulting from a Residential Customer's minor home improvement projects. 
6.4 Residential Recyclables Collection Service 
    6.4.1. FRANCHISEE shall collect Program Recyclables from Residential Customers according to the provisions herein. In addition, FRANCHISE shall collect Program Recyclables from all Residential Units approved to receive Supplemental Recyclable Collection from Residential Units pursuant to Section 6.7. of this Agreement. 
    6.4.2. FRANCHISEE shall collect Program Recyclables from Residential Customers utilizing Roll Cart Containers once per week in accordance with the Collection Schedule. See Article 9 for further details regarding Containers, including Roll Carts for Program Recyclables. Residential Customers will be instructed to place all Program Recyclables inside of designated Containers. 
6.5 Hours and Holidays. Residential Collection Service shall take place between 7:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. In the event Residential Collection Service normal collection day falls on a Holiday, FRANCHISEE shall provide collection on the next scheduled collection day, unless an earlier make-up date is agreed to between the CITY and the FRANCHISEE. 
6.6 Collection Point. FRANCHISEE collection of Solid Waste and Program Recyclables shall be at the Collection Point. Unless an exception has been granted for backdoor collection as set forth herein, the Collection Point shall be curbside, meaning that area within four (4) feet from the known edge of the paved street or the edge of the service alley, as the case may be. FRANCHISEE shall, at no additional cost to the Residential Customer or the CITY, provide backdoor collection of Solid Waste and Program Recyclables to Residential Customers who are unable to deliver their Solid Waste or Program Recyclables to the curbside, provided no other capable person resides in the home. FRANCHISEE shall commence backdoor collection within one (1) week of a request for backdoor collection, provided the request is supported by a written statement of a medical practitioner that the resident is unable to deliver Solid Waste and Recyclables to the curbside. 
6.7 Supplemental Service for Commercial-Style Collection from Residential Units. Subject to the approval of the Contract Manager, Residential Units may supplement Residential Solid Waste Collection Service to provide for commercial-style collection by requesting service as a Commercial Customer pursuant to Article[Section] 7 of this Agreement, in which case collection Containers shall be placed at locations that are mutually acceptable to FRANCHISEE and customer, subject to City Code. For customers utilizing other types of Containers as a supplemental service, FRANCHISEE collection shall be as needed and as appropriate, pursuant to the Collection Schedule for Commercial Customers. Residential Units approved to receive services as a Commercial Customer for commercial-style collection service shall be charged as a Commercial Customer receiving Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service as set forth in Article[Section] 7 of this Agreement. The CITY reserves the right, at its sole discretion, to designate a Residential Unit for commercial-style collection. 
In addition, despite being categorized as a Commercial Customer, the customer representing the Residential Unit authorized for commercial-style collection services is required to pay for the collection of Program Recyclables for each Residential Unit. FRANCHISEE shall provide such customers Supplemental Recyclable Collection from Residential Units, in which case collection Containers shall be placed at locations that are mutually acceptable to FRANCHISEE and customer, subject to City Code. For customers utilizing other types of Containers as a supplemental service, FRANCHISEE collection shall be as needed and as appropriate, pursuant to the Collection Schedule for Commercial Customers. Residential Units approved as a Commercial Customer shall be charged as a Commercial Customer receiving Supplemental Recyclable Collection from Residential Units as set forth in Article[Section] 7 of this Agreement. 
6.8 Notice of Non-Collection 
    6.8.1. In the event that the Solid Waste or Recyclable placed out for collection does not comply with the provisions of this Article[Section] 6, unless otherwise provided in this Article[Section] 6, FRANCHISEE is not required to collect the material. If FRANCHISEE elects to not collect such materials, a non-collection notice shall be placed on the container or non-compliant materials explaining why collection was not made. Notwithstanding anything in this Agreement to the contrary, FRANCHISEE acknowledges that higher generation of waste during Holiday weeks may result in occasional bags left outside of the designated Container and agrees that during Holiday weeks FRANCHISEE shall collect all bags left outside of the designated Container. 
    6.8.2. FRANCHISEE shall develop and produce non-collection notices for non-compliant material. The design and content of non-collection notices are subject to approval by the CITY. 
    6.8.3. As further specified in Section 13.2, within one (1) business Day of occurrence, FRANCHISEE shall electronically notify the Contract Manager regarding all non-collection events. 
SECTION 7. - COMMERCIAL SERVICE. 
7.1 FRANCHISEE shall collect and dispose of Solid Waste from Commercial Customers within the Franchise Area pursuant to the terms and conditions of this Article[Section] 7. FRANCHISEE shall collect and dispose of Program Recyclables from those Commercial Customers approved for Supplemental Recyclable Collection from Residential Units. 
7.2 Requests for Service. Eligible Commercial Customers include (i) Commercial Establishments and (ii) those Residential Units approved for supplemental commercial-style collection services as set forth in Section 6.7 of this Agreement and (iii) Special Event sponsors (except where the City is the sponsor of the Special Event). FRANCHISEE shall initiate, terminate, or change service for a Commercial Customer in writing. The Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service shall start, terminate, or change on the next scheduled collection day from the date requested or as otherwise agreed between FRANCHISEE and the Commercial Customer. 
7.3 Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service 
    7.3.1. FRANCHISEE shall collect Solid Waste from Commercial Customers according to the provisions herein. 
    7.3.2. Solid Waste Other Than Special Waste. 
    7.3.2.1 FRANCHISEE shall collect and dispose of Solid Waste other than Special Waste from Commercial Customers within the Franchise Area. 
    7.3.2.2 FRANCHISEE shall collect Solid Waste other than Special Waste from Commercial Customers at least once per week or pursuant to a Special Event permit, as the case may be. Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service shall be provided frequently enough to prevent the creation of a public nuisance or a threat to the public health, safety, or welfare. 
    7.3.3. Special Waste. This Agreement is not intended to require the FRANCHISEE to collect such Special Waste material generated by Commercial Customers, including Yard Trash, tires, Bulk Waste, biological waste, biomedical waste, construction and demolition debris, hazardous substance, hazardous waste, and sludge, as such terms are defined by § 403.703, Fla. Statute. 
    7.3.4. Collection Point. FRANCHISEE collection of Solid Waste from Commercial Customers shall be at the designated Collection Point, which Collection Point shall be the locations on the subject property that are mutually acceptable to FRANCHISEE and the Commercial Customer, and in compliance with City Code. If a dispute should arise between a Commercial Customer and FRANCHISEE regarding the Collection Point, the Contract Manager shall designate the Collection Point. 
    7.3.5. Hours and Holidays 
    7.3.5.1 Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service for Solid Waste other than Special Waste shall take place between 7:00 a.m. and 7:00 p.m. Monday through Sunday, except as otherwise agreed by the Contract Manager. Should the FRANCHISEE receive any complaints from residents that live in close proximity to the commercial routes and are adversely affected by early morning collection activity, the FRANCHISEE shall reroute the affected area subject to the approval of the Contract Manager. 
    7.3.5.2 FRANCHISEE shall not be required to provide Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service on Holidays. In the event Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service normal collection day falls on a Holiday, FRANCHISEE shall provide collection on the next scheduled collection day, unless an earlier make-up date is agreed to between the Commercial Customer and the FRANCHISEE. 
    7.3.6. FRANCHISEE shall provide Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service for Special Events pursuant to a written agreement between the FRANCHISEE and the Commercial Customer operating the Special Event and subject to the Special Event permit issued by the CITY. 
    7.3.7. Containers. Collection of Solid Waste (other than Special Waste) from Commercial Customers shall be from FRANCHISEE-provided Containers. See Article[Section] 9 for further details regarding Containers. If necessary, the Contract Manager shall assist FRANCHISEE and the Commercial Customer in confirming that the type and size of the collection Container and frequency of collection service are sufficient to ensure that Solid Waste is not routinely placed or stored outside of the designated Container. Commercial Customers utilizing Roll Carts shall be charged based upon a minimum of 2 cubic yards per week. Commercial Customers shall be instructed to place all Solid Waste inside of designated Containers. In the event that the Solid Waste placed out for collection is not placed inside of a designated Container and FRANCHISEE elects to collect the material, FRANCHISEE's additional charge shall reflect the number of additional cubic yards serviced. For example, if the Commercial Customer has been designated a dumpster Container sized for 8 cubic yards and items are placed outside of the Container, FRANCHISEE shall empty the dumpster (8 cubic yards) then FRANCHISEE may place the remaining items into the dumpster Container and empty it a second time (additional 8 cubic yards), resulting in twice the charge for servicing the dumpster Container two times. FRANCHISEE shall provide the Commercial Customer being charged for the additional service with a date-stamped photograph showing the reason for the additional service. If FRANCHISEE charges for such an additional service more than once during any twelve (12) month period, FRANCHISEE may require the Commercial Customer to receive a larger Container and to pay the rate for such larger Container. FRANCHISEE shall maintain a log of all additional services charged and Container sizes increased pursuant to this paragraph, and provide such log to the City upon request. 
7.4 Supplemental Recyclable Collection from Residential Units as Commercial Customers 
    7.4.1. FRANCISHEE shall collect Program Recyclables from all Residential Units approved as a Commercial Customer pursuant to Section 6.7 to receive Supplemental Recyclable Collection from Residential Units. For example, an apartment building with 100 residential units may receive solid waste collection from dumpster containers as a Commercial Customer. In addition to servicing the dumpster, FRANCHISEE is required to provide for collection of Program Recyclables from the apartment complex. In addition to the solid waste charge based upon cubic yards, the customer shall pay a recyclable charge based on the number of units in the apartment building. 
    7.4.2. Service shall be provided according to the provisions of Section 6.4 of this Agreement, except that references to "Residential Customer" therein shall refer to said Commercial Customer on behalf of the Residential Units. 
    7.4.3. As required by §§ 403.7046 and 403.713, Fla. Statutes, this Agreement is not intended to require the FRANCHISEE to collect Recyclables generated by commercial establishments and businesses. Supplemental Recyclable Collection Service is intended to service Residential Units and is categorized as a Commercial Customer only for purposes of this Agreement only in order to clarify that the style of collection utilizes commercial style collection (such as communal dumpsters) and that billing of such customers shall be provided by FRANCHISEE. 
SECTION 8. - CITY PROPERTY. 
8.1 At no additional charge to the CITY, FRANCHISEE shall collect and dispose of Solid Waste (other than Special Waste) and Program Recyclables from the City Property and for Special Events pursuant to the terms and conditions of this Article[Section] 8. 
8.2 FRANCHISEE shall collect Solid Waste other than Special Waste and shall collect Program Recyclables, which materials are generated by the general public in parks, picnic areas, city streets, golf courses and property owned, leased, rented and controlled by the CITY. 
8.3 Collection from City Property shall be in accordance with the collection schedule and FRANCHISEE-provided Containers listed on the attached Exhibit "A." See Article[Section] 9 for further details regarding Containers. Solid Waste and Program Recyclables collection service on the City Property shall be provided frequently enough to prevent the creation of a public nuisance or a threat to the public health, safety, or welfare. 
8.4 Collection Point. FRANCHISEE collection of Solid Waste and Program Recyclables from City Property shall be at the Collection Point, which Collection Point for each of the properties listed as City Property shall be the locations on the subject property determined by the Contract Manager. 
8.5 Special Events. FRANCHISEE shall collect Solid Waste and Program Recyclables for Special Events sponsored by the City at no additional cost to the City. Collection shall be in accordance with the Special Events permit issued by the City. Special Events that are not sponsored by the City receive collection services as a Commercial Customer pursuant to Section 7 of this Agreement. 
SECTION 9. - CONTAINERS. 
9.1 Franchisee-provided Roll Cart Containers 
    9.1.1. Technical Specifications. All Roll Carts must meet the following technical specifications: 
a.  The quality of each Roll Cart shall be the manufacturer's latest design with a uniform thickness throughout the body of the container of at least 0.15 inch. 
b.  The construction material of each Roll Cart shall be high-density polyethylene with a minimum of 30% post-consumer recycled content. Off-spec or wide-spec material and dry blending of material is not acceptable. 
c.  Roll Carts shall be available in three sizes: a 96-gallon capacity (+/- 3%), a 64-gallon capacity (+/- 3%), and a 35-gallon capacity (+/- 3%). 
d.  The color of all Roll Carts shall be uniform throughout the Franchise Area and the color shall be selected by the Contract Manager on behalf of the CITY. 
e.  The load rating of each Roll Cart shall be a minimum of 3.5 lbs. per gallon and in conformance with ANSI Standard Z245.30. 
f.  All Roll Carts shall be capable of being wheeled to the Collection Point. All Roll Carts shall be equipped with attached lids. All Roll Carts must identify FRANCHISEE's customer service telephone number in legible typeset no larger than 2" in height. 
g.  At no additional charge to the customer or the CITY, FRANCHISEE shall warranty each Roll Cart for the term of this Agreement. Roll Carts shall be maintained in good working order. Rolls Carts without an attached lid shall be considered damaged and in need of repair, up to and including replacement. 
h.  Each Roll Cart shall be suited for a lift system such that it is compatible with the standard American semi-automated bar-locking lifters and fully-automated arm lifters. The upper lift point must be integrally molded into the body of the cart with sufficient support under the lifting pocket for 96-, 65- and 35-gallon containers. Bolted-on bars are not acceptable. 
i.  All Roll Carts must meet the requirements of ANSI Z245.30 and ANSI Z245.60 standards for "Type B/G" containers. 
j.  Roll-Cart Specifications may be modified with the written consent of the Contract Manager but only if the FRANCHISEE provides the CITY with a certificate of structural integrity issued by a licensed engineer that reflects the intent of the subject specification set forth in this Agreement. 
    9.1.2. Residential Customers. 
    9.1.2.1 Prior to the Commencement Date in accordance with transition plan specified in Article[Section] 5 and within three (3) business Days of registering as a newly serviced property, at no additional charge to the customer or the CITY, FRANCHISEE shall provide Solid Waste Roll Carts and Recycling Roll Carts for all Residential Customers within the Franchise Area. 
    9.1.2.2 Ownership of Roll Carts provided for Residential Customers shall rest with FRANCHISEE. 
    9.1.2.3 The standard program-size Roll Carts include one ninety-six (96) gallon cart for Solid Waste and one sixty-four (64) gallon cart for Program Recyclables issued to each Residential Customer. However, 96-, 64-, and 35-gallon Solid Waste and Recycling Roll Cart sizes will be made available for Residential Customers that request alternative sizes. 
    9.1.2.4 Following the first ninety (90) days of service, upon request, FRANCHISEE shall exchange a Residential Customer's Roll Cart with an alternatively-sized Roll Cart. FRANCHISEE shall provide one (1) Roll Cart exchange for Solid Waste and one (1) Roll Cart for Recyclables per customer at no charge to the customer or the CITY. Should a Residential Customer request additional exchanges, FRANCHISEE may charge the Residential Customer no more than twenty-five dollars ($25) per Roll Cart that is exchanged. 
    9.1.2.5 If a Residential Customer generates large quantities of Solid Waste, the customer may request one (1) additional Roll Cart to accommodate the extra materials and FRANCHISEE may charge a one-time fee of no more than sixty dollars ($60) per additional Roll Cart delivered. 
    9.1.2.6 If a Residential Customer generates large quantities of Program Recyclables, the customer may request an additional Roll Cart to accommodate the extra materials and FRANCHISEE may charge a one-time fee of no more than sixty dollars ($60) per additional Roll Cart delivered. 
    9.1.3. At no additional charge to the customer or the CITY, FRANCHISEE shall repair or replace a Roll Cart within three (3) business Days of receiving notice from the CITY or customer of the need for repair. 
    9.1.4. All new or replacement Roll Carts shall be delivered to the customer within three (3) business Days from the date of request with a CITY-provided new customer information packet attached. 
9.2 Customer-provided Yard Trash Containers. 
    9.2.1. Containers utilized by Residential Customers for Yard Trash are provided by the customer. 
    9.2.2. Technical Specifications. A Container utilized for Yard Trash shall be a plastic or galvanized metal container of a type commonly sold as a garbage can with a capacity not to exceed 40 gallons. 
    9.2.3. FRANCHISEE shall replace personal containers used for Yard Trash of a Residential Customer within three (3) business Days after being notified by the CITY or customer that FRANCHISEE or its employees damaged the customer's container. FRANCHISEE shall provide a replacement container (as applicable) that is similar in style, material, quality, and capacity to the customer's original container. FRANCHISEE is not responsible for a replacement container if it can satisfactorily prove to the Contract Manager that FRANCHISEE or its employees did not damage the Customer's container. 
9.3 FRANCHISEE-provided Commercial Containers 
    9.3.1. The following types of Containers constitute designated Containers from which FRANCHISEE shall collect Solid Waste and Recyclables from Commercial Customers: Roll Cart, Dumpster, Compactor Roll-off, and Solar Containers. 
    9.3.2. Technical Specifications 
    9.3.2.1 Roll Cart Container. Roll Cart Containers utilized by Commercial Customers shall comply with Section 9.1. Commercial Customers utilizing Roll Carts shall be charged based upon a minimum of 2 cubic yards per week. 
    9.3.2.2 Dumpster Container. Dumpsters utilized by Commercial Customers shall be a metal or mechanical container varying in size from two to eight cubic yards, which is emptied by a front-end load-type truck. 
    9.3.2.3 Compactor Roll-off Containers. Compactor Roll-off containers utilized by a Commercial Customer shall be unit(s) varying in capacity of 15 cubic yards and greater that is used for collecting, storing, and transporting waste, which is normally loaded onto a motor vehicle and transported to a disposal facility for dumping. The unit may be of the open or enclosed variety. 
    9.3.2.4 Solar Containers. All solar containers shall be solar trash compactor units with attached recycling units allowing for regular monitoring by FRANCHISEE. 
SECTION 10. - COMMUNITY CLEANUPS. 
FRANCHISEE shall perform four (4) community cleanups within the Franchise Area each calendar year. Community cleanups are typically a single day event on a weekend. The times and locations of the community cleanups shall be selected by the Contract Manager after coordinating with FRANCHISEE. FRANCHISEE shall provide appropriate containers during each community cleanup at no additional cost to the CITY or to the sponsor. During the community cleanup, FRANCHISEE shall collect only Solid Waste other than Special Waste, Program Recyclables, and Bulk Trash. FRANCHISEE shall transport these materials to the appropriate Designated Facility for disposal at no additional cost to the CITY or the sponsor. 
SECTION 11. - DESIGNATED FACILITY. 
11.1 Solid Waste and Program Recyclables 
    11.1.1. FRANCHISEE shall deliver Solid Waste (including Bulk Trash and Yard Trash) and Program Recyclables collected pursuant to this Agreement to the Designated Facilities set forth below: 
Solid Waste other than Special Waste: Sarno Road Transfer Station, 3379 Sarno Road, Melbourne, Florida 
Special Waste - Bulk Trash: Sarno Road Landfill, 3379 Sarno Road, Melbourne, Florida 
Special Waste - Yard Trash: Sarno Road Landfill, 3379 Sarno Road, Melbourne, Florida 
Program Recyclables: Single Stream Recyclers LLC, 650 Townsend Road, Cocoa, Florida 
    11.1.2. All Designated Facilities shall be properly licensed to receive the collected materials. Program Recyclables shall be delivered to a licensed Recovery Materials Processing Facility, as defined and by Chapter 403, Part IV, Florida Statutes. 
    11.1.3. The location of the Designated Facility may be changed by the FRANCHISEE or the CITY. Should the CITY change the Designated Facility during the term of the Agreement, collection rates may be adjusted according to the average change in distance driven by FRANCHISEE. Supporting information justifying the need for an adjustment in collection rates will be required. 
    11.1.4. FRANCHISEE shall pay the applicable fees at the Designated Facilities for the disposal of all materials collected pursuant to this Agreement. 
SECTION 12. - ADDITIONAL FRANCHISEE RESPONSIBILITIES. 
12.1 Restrictions on Collection of Mixed Loads 
    12.1.1. FRANCHISEE shall collect Solid Waste and Program Recyclables generated in the Franchise Area pursuant to Articles[Sections] 6 and 7 separate from any materials generated outside of the Franchise Area. 
    12.1.2. FRANCHISEE shall collect Solid Waste generated by Residential Customers separate from that generated by Commercial Customers. 
    12.1.3. FRANCHISEE shall not mix or commingle Program Recyclables with Solid Waste. FRANCHISEE shall collect Program Recyclables generated by Residential Units separate from Program Recyclables generated by Commercial Customers. 
    12.1.4. FRANCHISEE shall collect Solid Waste, Special Waste, Yard Trash, and Program Recyclables separate from each other, and shall not combine loads of different material types. FRANCHISEE shall be responsible for all disposal costs, whether associated with loads of mixed materials or otherwise. 
12.2 Routes and Schedules 
    12.2.1. FRANCHISEE shall provide routes and map information in GIS-compatible format to the Contract Manager at least thirty (30) Days prior to the Commencement Date and annually thereafter. All updates during the term of this Agreement shall be provided in a GIS-compatible format. 
    12.2.2. FRANCHISEE shall not change the scheduled collection days until FRANCHISEE receives the Contract Manager's prior written authorization. The Contract Manager's approval of such changes shall not be unreasonably withheld. In the event that the Contract Manager authorizes a change in schedule that alters the collection day for any Residential Customer, FRANCHISEE shall, at its expense, notify each affected Residential Customer by mail or other manner approved by the Contract Manager not less than twenty (20) Days prior to the change. Additionally, FRANCHISEE shall, at its expense, publish notice of such authorized change to the collection schedule in the Florida Today newspaper published for Brevard County at least ten (10) days prior to the effective date of such collection schedule change. 
12.3 Manner of Collection 
    12.3.1. All Containers shall be completely emptied and placed back in an upright position at the Collection Point. Containers with an unattached lid shall be completely emptied and placed back in an upright or inverted position with the lid set on top, or placed beside the container, at the Collection Point. Roll Carts shall be placed with the lid in the closed position. 
    12.3.2. FRANCHISEE shall provide all collection services with as little noise and disturbance as possible to residents. 
    12.3.3. No trespassing by FRANCHISEE's employees will be permitted. 
    12.3.4. No FRANCHISEE employee shall remove or tamper with any property not placed for collection. 
    12.3.5. All collection vehicles shall remain on the right-hand side of the road when providing collection service and at no time shall collection crews cross to the left-hand side of the road to retrieve Containers or materials that have been set out for collection. 
    12.3.6. FRANCHISEE's vehicles shall not unduly interfere with vehicular or pedestrian traffic. Vehicles shall not be left on the street unattended. 
12.4 Protection of Private and Public Property 
    12.4.1. FRANCHISEE acknowledges that the Collection Points on rights-of-way are frequently co-located with other utility easements. Therefore, particular attention shall be given to the location of water meters, transformers, guy wires, utility poles, and irrigation structures. Authorization to use the right-of-way does not abrogate FRANCHISEE's responsibility to exercise caution in relationship to the interests of other authorized users. 
    12.4.2. FRANCHISEE shall take care to prevent damage to all public and private property while conducting services pursuant to this Agreement, including, but not limited to, buildings, monuments, markers or fences, vehicles, pipes and underground structures, storm water inlet covers, gutters, curbs, public streets, trees and tree canopies, flowers, shrubs, and other plantings. The CITY acknowledges this does not preclude normal wear and tear of streets resulting from normal use by FRANCHISEE. 
    12.4.3. FRANCHISEE shall promptly notify the Contract Manager of any personal injury or damage to public or private property caused by FRANCHISEE during the provision of collection services. Wherever such property is damaged due to the activities of FRANCHISEE, it shall be promptly restored to its original condition by FRANCHISEE at FRANCHISEE's expense. In addition, if on CITY property, FRANCHISEE shall submit an accident/investigation report within forty-eight (48) hours to Contract Manager and the City's Risk Manager. 
    12.4.4. In case of failure on the part of FRANCHISEE to restore such property or make good such damage or injury, the CITY may, upon forty-eight (48) hours written notice to FRANCHISEE, proceed to repair, rebuild, or otherwise restore such property as may be deemed necessary and to bill the cost to FRANCHISEE. If any damage caused by FRANCHISEE impacts the safety, health and welfare of the CITY's citizens, the repairs will be arranged by the CITY and billed to FRANCHISEE based on the actual cost incurred to repair the said damages, plus ten percent (10%) to account for the CITY's administrative costs. 
12.5 Spillage and Littering 
    12.5.1. FRANCHISEE shall not litter or cause any spillage to occur upon the premises or the right-of-way wherein the collection and transport of materials shall occur. During transportation, all collected materials shall be contained, tied, or enclosed to prevent leaking, spilling and blowing. 
    12.5.2. In the event of any confirmed spillage/leakage/blowing from a FRANCHISEE's vehicle, FRANCHISEE shall immediately clean up all spillage/leakage/blowing at no cost to the CITY. FRANCHISEE is responsible to clean such spills, leaks, or blown materials to the satisfaction of the Contract Manager up to, and including, additional work to restore the area to its previous condition, resealing or resurfacing depending on the severity of the damage. If FRANCHISEE can satisfactorily prove to the Contract Manager that the responsibility for the spillage/leakage/blowing belongs to a third party, then FRANCHISEE will not be responsible for the cleanup. 
12.6 Collection Plan. FRANCHISEE shall maintain the collection plan submitted with its bid and initially developed during the transition prior to Commencement Date in accordance with Article 5, describing in detail how FRANCHISEE will provide collection services in compliance with the requirements in this Agreement. The collection plan and all revisions to the plan are subject to the Contract Manager's prior written approval. Any change to the collection plan shall be submitted to the Contract Manager for approval. 
12.7 Permits and Licenses. FRANCHISEE shall obtain, at its own expense, all permits and licenses required by Applicable Law and maintain same in full force and effect. Any revocation of FRANCHISEE's licenses or permits shall be reported to the CITY within three (3) Days. 
12.8 Relationship with the City. FRANCHISEE shall cooperate with the CITY in every reasonable way to facilitate the successful completion of the activities contemplated in this Agreement. FRANCHISEE shall assign a qualified person or persons as a point of contact to be in charge of FRANCHISEE's operations within the Franchise Area. The CITY shall have direct access to FRANCHISEE's point of contact as designated by FRANCHISEE. The CITY's point of contact shall be the Contract Manager. Alternates may be designated by either party upon written notification. 
12.9 Personnel 
    12.9.1. FRANCHISEE shall provide personnel, including sufficient managers and supervisors, to perform the collection services of this Agreement to the satisfaction of the CITY. 
    12.9.2. FRANCHISEE shall devote sufficient personnel, time, and attention to its operations under this Agreement to ensure that its performance will be satisfactory to the CITY. 
    12.9.3. FRANCHISEE shall maintain a drug-free workplace program in accordance with § 287.087, Fla. Stat. At least annually, FRANCHISEE shall notify its employees in writing that the unlawful manufacture, distribution, dispensing, possession, or illegal use of a controlled substance is prohibited while on-duty and specifying the actions that will be taken against employees for violations of such prohibition. 
    12.9.4. FRANCHISEE shall designate at least one operations manager and other key personnel to manage the performance of FRANCHISEE's duties. Within three (3) business Days following the Effective Date, FRANCHISEE shall provide the Contract Manager with a written list containing the names, addresses, emails, and telephone numbers of FRANCHISEE's operations manager and other key personnel, and the telephone numbers that are to be used to contact FRANCHISEE in the event of an emergency. While performing collection services pursuant to this Agreement, at least one employee shall be on-duty who is authorized to receive orders from such operations manager and key personnel and then act upon those orders. 
    12.9.5. FRANCHISEE shall use competent, qualified, sober, drug-free personnel to provide collection services pursuant to this Agreement. 
    12.9.6. FRANCHISEE shall only utilize employees of FRANCHISEE performing work under this Agreement that have no record of criminal convictions involving drugs, assault or combative behavior, or theft within the last five years. FRANCHISEE understands that such employees may be subject to criminal history investigations by the CITY and may be denied access to the CITY's facilities in the event of such criminal convictions. 
    12.9.7. FRANCHISEE shall furnish each employee with an appropriate means of identifying him or her as an employee of FRANCHISEE. At a minimum each FRANCHISEE employee shall have a uniform with a nametag and company logo. FRANCHISEE's employees shall wear the identification at all times while on duty. 
    12.9.8. All of FRANCHISEE's personnel shall maintain a courteous and respectful attitude at all times. FRANCHISEE shall instruct its employees to avoid loud or profane language at all times during the performance of their duties under this Agreement. FRANCHISEE's employees shall not conduct themselves in a negligent, disorderly, or dishonest manner. 
    12.9.9. FRANCHISEE shall comply with all Applicable Law relating to wages, hours, overtime, disability, and all other matters relating to the employment and protection of employees, now or hereafter in effect. 
    12.9.10. The CITY reserves the right to disapprove and request removal of any FRANCHISEE personnel assigned to the CITY's work. Such disapproval or request shall be for reasonable cause only and shall be addressed in writing to FRANCHISEE. Notwithstanding the foregoing, FRANCHISEE shall not be required to take any action with regard to FRANCHISEE's personnel that would violate any Applicable Law. 
    12.9.11. All of FRANCHISEE's employees shall be qualified and appropriately trained for the tasks assigned to them. FRANCHISEE shall provide refresher courses and additional training to its employees, as needed, to ensure compliance with the requirements of this Agreement and all Applicable Law. The CITY has the right to review FRANCHISEE's training records. 
    12.9.12. At all times when operating vehicle or equipment pursuant to this Agreement, FRANCHISEE's employees shall carry a valid Florida driver's license for the type of vehicle or equipment being operated. 
12.10 Office Requirements 
    12.10.1. FRANCHISEE shall maintain an office in Brevard County, Florida to remain open from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., Monday through Friday, except Holidays. 
    12.10.2. FRANCHISEE shall maintain a local telephone number where service inquiries and complaints can be received by FRANCHISEE. FRANCHISEE shall use either a telephone answering service or answering machine to receive service inquiries and complaints during those times when the office is closed. During office hours, these services must be monitored regularly, so that FRANCHISEE can respond to any message within sixty (60) minutes. The response, at a minimum, shall include a reply to the inquiry and a plan of action to address or resolve the complaint. During non-office hours, messages shall be answered no later than noon the following business Day. 
    12.10.3. FRANCHISEE's office shall be equipped with adequate and appropriate personnel and equipment to receive, document, and respond to inquiries, issues, and complaints in a timely manner as set forth in section 12.11 of this Agreement. FRANCHISEE's office staff shall be familiar with the CITY and FRANCHISEE's obligations under this Agreement. 
    12.10.4. FRANCHISEE shall establish a process, subject to the Contract Manager's approval, for receiving and handling emergency calls, both during and after normal operating hours. 
12.11 Customer Service Standards 
    12.11.1. FRANCHISEE shall be responsible for providing the highest quality service to all Residential Customers and Commercial Customers under the provisions of this Agreement. FRANCHISEE shall perform every reasonable act to minimize customer complaints. 
    12.11.2. If the CITY or a customer notifies FRANCHISEE before noon of a missed collection Monday through Friday, FRANCHISEE shall return to the customer's premises before 6:00 p.m. the same Day of the notification and collect all of the Solid Waste or Program Recyclables that have been set out for collection. If FRANCHISEE is notified after noon Monday through Friday of a missed collection, collection shall be made by noon the next business Day following notification. Any missed collections that are not remedied as outlined above shall be considered a complaint. 
    12.11.3. If the CITY receives a complaint regarding FRANCHISEE's service under this Agreement, the complaint shall be immediately forwarded to FRANCHISEE by telephone or electronic communication. FRANCHISEE shall resolve all complaints as expeditiously as possible and shall take whatever steps are necessary to remedy the cause of a complaint within one (1) business Day after receiving a complaint from the CITY. 
    12.11.4. Upon resolution of the complaint, FRANCHISEE shall notify the CITY within one (1) business Day, by telephone or electronic communication, of the action taken to resolve the complaint. 
    12.11.5. FRANCHISEE shall also notify the Contract Manager regarding any disputes that have not been resolved within one (1) business Day after receiving the complaint. FRANCHISEE may request, and the Contract Manager may grant, additional time to remedy a complaint when necessary. If a dispute is not resolved to a Residential or Commercial Customer's satisfaction, the CITY shall have the authority to determine how the dispute will be resolved. 
    12.11.6. FRANCHISEE shall keep a written record of all complaints it receives regarding FRANCHISEE's service under this Agreement. FRANCHISEE shall use a standard form to record the pertinent facts regarding each complaint and how it was resolved. The form shall identify source of the complaint (customer name, customer type - residential or commercial, and contact information), the time and date when a complaint was received, when FRANCHISEE responded to the complaint, and the date and time when the complaint was resolved. FRANCHISEE's records and forms shall be kept up to date and a record of all complaints shall be submitted monthly as outlined in Section 13.2.2. In addition, FRANCHISEE's records and forms shall be maintained throughout the term of this Agreement. Copies of the complaints and forms shall be kept at FRANCHISEE's office in Brevard County, Florida and shall be available for inspection by the Contract Manager during normal business hours. 
12.12 Vehicle and Collection Equipment 
    12.12.1. General Requirements 
    12.12.1.1 FRANCHISEE shall maintain a dedicated fleet of collection vehicles designated for the Franchise Area to fulfill this Agreement. The vehicles shall be stored and maintained in Brevard County. All frontline vehicles shall be clean and well-maintained. The CITY reserves the right, at its discretion, to require a vehicle be taken out of service for habitual maintenance issues. 
    12.12.1.2 FRANCHISEE shall purchase and/or lease, maintain, and repair all of the vehicles and equipment necessary to comply with the requirements of this Agreement. FRANCHISEE's vehicles and equipment shall be compatible (in size and weight) with, and appropriate for, the areas where such vehicles and equipment are utilized. 
    12.12.1.3 All of FRANCHISEE's collection vehicles shall have waterproof seals and shall be watertight to a depth sufficient to prevent the discharge or leaking of liquids that have accumulated in the vehicle's cargo area during loading and transport operations. 
    12.12.1.4 All collection vehicles shall have a fully enclosed metal top, or be equipped with either a net with mesh not greater than one and one-half (1.5) inches, or tarpaulin. The metal top, net and tarpaulin, as the case may be, shall be kept in good mechanical order and used to cover the load during the loading operation, in traveling on the road and when parked if the contents are likely to be scattered absent a cover. 
    12.12.1.5 All collection vehicles shall be painted a uniform color. 
    12.12.1.6 All vehicles used to provide Collection Service under this Agreement shall be equipped at all times with: (a) all safety supplies, equipment, and first aid supplies required by Applicable Laws; (b) a fire extinguisher; (c) a heavy-duty broom, a rake, and a large dustpan; (d) a spill response kit; and (e) an audible back-up warning device. The spill response kit shall be suitable and adequate for cleaning up any leaks or spills of oil, hydraulic fluid, or other liquids from FRANCHISEE's collection vehicles. 
    12.12.1.7 FRANCHISEE shall have sufficient reserve vehicles and equipment available to complete daily routes. The use of reserve vehicles and equipment shall include, but not be limited to, occasions when frontline vehicles and equipment are out of service, or when unanticipated delays will prevent frontline vehicles and equipment from completing the collection route(s) within the established hours of collection. 
    12.12.1.8 The reserve vehicles and equipment shall be in service within two (2) hours of any breakdown or delay of the frontline collection vehicle. The reserve vehicles and equipment shall be similar in size and capacity to the vehicles and equipment being replaced. 
    12.12.2. Maintenance and Cleaning 
    12.12.2.1 FRANCHISEE shall monitor, maintain and repair its collection vehicles and equipment, at a minimum, in compliance with this Agreement, the manufacturer's recommendations and Applicable Law. Oil/hydraulic systems and waterproof seals/enclosures shall be kept in good condition at all times to prevent spills and leaks. 
    12.12.2.2 FRANCHISEE shall keep all collection vehicles and equipment cleaned. All collection vehicles used for the collection of Solid Waste and Recyclables shall be washed thoroughly and sanitized with a suitable disinfectant and deodorant at least once each week, unless the Contract Manager approves an alternate cleaning schedule. Other collection vehicles shall be cleaned and washed, as necessary, to minimize the potential for odors and nuisance conditions. 
    12.12.3. Vehicle Identification 
    12.12.3.1 No advertising shall be permitted on FRANCHISEE's vehicles. 
    12.12.3.2 FRANCHISEE's vehicles shall clearly display FRANCHISEE's telephone number printed in letters not less than four inches (4") on each side of the vehicle. 
    12.12.3.3 FRANCHISEE vehicles shall be numbered with numbers not less than four inches (4") high on each side of the vehicle. Franchise shall keep a record of the vehicle to which each number is assigned. 
    12.12.4. The CITY reserves the right to conduct periodic inspections of operations, vehicles, and equipment to ensure compliance with federal and state commercial motor vehicle statues, as well as the above requirements. 
SECTION 13. - RECORD KEEPING AND REPORTING. 
13.1 Record Keeping. FRANCHISEE shall maintain books, records, documents, time and cost accounts, and other evidence directly related to its provision or performance of services under this Agreement. All time records and cost data shall be maintained in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles during the time of the Agreement and at least three (3) years thereafter. The CITY shall have the right to perform audits of FRANCHISEE's records at the CITY's expense, whenever the CITY deems it necessary. Notwithstanding anything to the foregoing, FRANCHISEE shall comply with the public records laws as referenced in Section 21.12 below. 
13.2 Reporting 
    13.2.1. Daily Report: Within one (1) business Day of occurrence, FRANCHISEE shall electronically notify the Contract Manager of any of the events listed below, in a format approved by the Contract Manager. If no such events occur, no notification is necessary. 
a.  Non-collection as specified in Section 6.8.3. 
b.  Incidences of personal injury or property damage, including vehicular damage, to public or private property by FRANCHISEE as specified in Section 12.4.3. 
c.  Spillage and Littering occurrences as specified in Section 12.5. 
    13.2.2. Monthly Report: Prior to the fifteenth (15) Day of each month during the term of this Agreement, FRANCHISEE shall electronically submit a report to the Contract Manager in a format approved by the Contract Manager. The report shall contain the following information for the previous service month: 
a.  A summary of Complaints as specified in Section 12.11.6 with residential and commercial complaints listed separately. 
b.  Documentation and calculation of Franchise Fee linked to the previous list and identifying total monthly invoice and gross revenue received: 
 Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service (identify each Commercial Customer and subject property); and 
 Residential Units receiving supplemental commercial-style Solid Waste collection service as Commercial Customers; and 
 Residential Units receiving supplemental commercial-style Recyclables collection service as Commercial Customers (identify types of materials collected, such as segregated cardboard, paper, or commingled containers). 
c.  Documentation of all activities conducted by the FRANCHISEE to encourage participation in recycling. 
    13.2.3. Annual Reports: 
    13.2.3.1 Recycling Participation: FRANCHISEE shall, on or before March 31 of each year, determine the number of Commercial Customers participating in the Commercial Recyclables Collection Service. In addition, the CITY may request a participation report, as needed. 
    13.2.3.2 Recycling Weight: FRANCHISEE shall, on or before March 31 of each year, determine the weight of Program Recyclables collected within the Franchise Area for Residential Customers and Commercial Customers. In addition, the CITY may request a weight report, as needed. 
    13.2.3.3 Vehicle List: On or before March 31 of each year, FRANCHISEE shall provide the Contract Manager with a list of the vehicles and other collection equipment that will be used by FRANCHISEE to provide services under this Agreement. This list shall include the license tag number and age for each vehicle. FRANCHISEE shall revise and resubmit the list to the Contract Manager during the term of this Agreement if there are any changes to the list of vehicles or other collection equipment. The requirements of this paragraph do not apply to: (a) vehicles used in the Franchise Area for thirty (30) Days or less; or (b) bona fide demonstration trucks. 
    13.2.3.4 Financial Report: Annually, FRANCHISEE shall provide to the Contract Manager its Corporate Annual Report that includes audited financial statements. The audited financial statements shall be delivered to the CITY upon completion but no less than annually. The Contract Manager may waive the requirement of an audited financial statement upon good cause. 
    13.2.3.5 Customer List: Annually, FRANCHISEE shall provide the Contract Manager lists of customers receiving each of the following services (including customer name, address, container size, frequency of collection, and billing rate): 
 Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service (identify each Commercial Customer and subject property); and 
 Residential Units receiving supplemental commercial-style Solid Waste collection service as Commercial Customers; and 
 Residential Units receiving supplemental commercial-style Recyclables collection service as Commercial Customers (identify types of materials collected, such as segregated cardboard, paper, or commingled containers). 
    The list shall identify the number of months of service and the corresponding Container size for each Commercial Customer. 
    13.2.4. FRANCHISEE shall provide any additional information or reports as requested by the Contract Manager to monitor this Agreement or the CITY's Solid Waste and Recyclables programs. 
SECTION 14. - PUBLIC EDUCATION AND AWARENESS PROGRAM. 
14.1 FRANCHISEE and the CITY shall develop a public information program to encourage the residents and businesses in the Franchise Area to reduce the amount of Solid Waste generated, recycle whenever possible, and safely manage and dispose of Solid Waste that is not recycled. The program also will provide the public with information concerning FRANCHISEE's services, fees, level of service and any proposed changes in those fees or services. FRANCHISEE's participation in the public awareness program shall be at no additional cost to the CITY or the customer. 
14.2 Annual Mailing. At least once per year, FRANCHISEE shall distribute brochures or other written informational material concerning the CITY's public information program regarding Solid Waste and Program Recyclables. In addition to information about the program, these written materials will provide information regarding collection procedures, days and routes, service rates, regulations and complaint procedures and the format shall be prepared by the CITY. FRANCHISEE shall duplicate and deliver the materials to Residential Customers and Commercial Customers via U.S. mail, or as approved by the Contract Manager, at no additional cost to the CITY or customer. 
14.3 Recycling. FRANCHISEE is committed to assist the CITY in accomplishing the Florida Legislature's goal of achieving seventy-five percent (75%) recycling by the year 2020. Efforts will be focused on increasing waste diversion with residential, multi-family, and commercial generators. FRANCHISEE shall provide written informational material about the CITY's recycling program, which written material shall be delivered to participating customers with the delivery of each recycling Container. FRANCHISEE will have a designated Commercial Account Manager to direct FRANCHISEE efforts to work directly with businesses to review current container size and service frequency, and provide an analysis detailing cost savings that may be realized by adding a recycling program. 
14.4 As requested by the CITY, FRANCHISEE shall attend and participate in public meetings regarding the CITY's recycling program, including but not limited to homeowners association meetings and civic organizations. 
14.5 [Omitted.] 
14.6 All forms of communication regarding the CITY's programs including, but not limited to, electronic, written, audio, video, graphics, logos, etc., shall be reviewed and approved by the Contract Manager prior to disseminating or presenting publically. 
SECTION 15. - FRANCHISE FEE. 
The Franchise Fee shall pertain to all Residential Solid Waste Collection Service, Residential Recyclables Collection Service, and Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service, including provision of collection services for Commercial Establishments, Residential Units supplementing with commercial-style collection and Special Event applicants. FRANCHISEE shall pay the CITY a Franchise Fee in the amount of ten percent (10%) of gross revenues collected in the immediately preceding month pursuant to the Franchise granted herein, which payment shall be provided to the CITY on or before the last calendar Day of each month. 
SECTION 16. - BILLING, RATES AND COMPENSATION. 
16.1 Residential Customers 
    16.1.1. Billing of Residential Customers shall be the sole responsibility of the CITY. FRANCHISEE shall not send billing information to Residential Customers, unless otherwise directed by the CITY and approved in writing by the CITY. No additional fees or charges for Residential Solid Waste Collection Services or Residential Recyclable Collection Service provided for in this Agreement shall be billed by FRANCHISEE. Invoicing by the CITY to the Residential Customers shall be monthly. Upon collection of invoiced accounts, the CITY shall make payment to the FRANCHISEE as set forth in this Section 16.1. 
    16.1.2. Rate. Customer rate for Solid Waste and Recyclables collection for Residential Customers is provided in Exhibit "D." The Residential collection service rate set forth in this Agreement is the total rate that may be charged to a Residential Customer, subject to CPI adjustment as set forth in Section 16.3 below. 
    16.1.3. Franchise Fee. FRANCHISEE shall be obligated to pay the CITY the Franchise Fee for all Residential Solid Waste Collection Service and Residential Recyclables Collection Service as set forth in Article[Section] 6. For Residential Solid Waste Collection Service and Residential Recyclables Collection Service, as services billed by the CITY, the CITY shall retain from payment to the FRANCHISEE a Franchise Fee in the amount of ten percent (10%) of gross revenues collected from Residential Customers in the immediately preceding month pursuant to the Franchise granted herein. 
    16.1.4. Billing Fee. FRANCHISEE shall be obligated to pay the CITY a Billing Fee for each bill sent by the City to a Residential Customer. For Residential Solid Waste Collection Service and Residential Recyclables Collection Service, as services billed by the CITY, the CITY shall retain from payment to the FRANCHISEE the Billing Fees collected from Residential Customers in the immediately preceding month pursuant to the Franchise granted herein. The Billing Fee shall be $0.82 per bill sent to a Residential Customer, subject to CPI adjustment as set forth in Section 16.3 below. 
    16.1.5. Net Revenues. CITY shall remit to FRANCHISEE the net revenue collected by Residential Customers in the immediately preceding month pursuant to the Franchise granted herein. For purposes of this Section 16.1, Net Revenues shall refer to the Residential Solid Waste Collection Services rate and the Residential Recyclables Collection Services rate collected less the Franchise Fees and Billing Fees retained by the CITY. The CITY shall make payment of Net Revenues to FRANCHISEE for all undisputed amounts on or before the thirtieth (30th) Day of each calendar month-following the previous month's collection of invoiced accounts from the Residential Customers. For example, payments received from the Residential Customers by the CITY in September shall be reflected in the CITY's payment to the FRANCHISEE by October 30. 
16.2 Commercial Customers 
    16.2.1. Billing of Commercial Customers shall be the sole responsibility of FRANCHISEE. Invoicing by FRANCHISEE to Commercial Customers shall be monthly in advance of services rendered, with the exception of roll-off pull and disposal charges which shall be billed in arrears. FRANCHISEE may discontinue service to a Commercial Customer upon non-payment for two (2) consecutive months. FRANCHISEE shall notify Contract Manager prior to discontinuing service due to non-payment. Notwithstanding the foregoing, invoicing of Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service related to Special Events shall be by FRANCHISEE within thirty days of services rendered and subject to a written agreement between the Special Event applicant as the Commercial Customer and FRANCHISEE. 
    16.2.2. Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service. 
    16.2.2.1 Rate for Solid Waste Collection. The customer rate for Solid Waste collection for Commercial Customers is provided in Exhibit "D," subject to CPI adjustment as set forth in Section 16.3 below. The Commercial Solid Waste Collection Services rate as set forth in this Agreement is the total rate that may be charged to Commercial Customers for collection of Solid Waste other than Special Waste. No additional fees or charges shall be billed by FRANCHISEE to the Commercial Customer for Commercial Solid Waste Collection Services, except that if an additional nominal feature is requested by the Commercial Customer to enhance the Container (i.e. locks, casters, etc.) then FRANCHISEE may bill the Commercial Customer an incidental charge for such requested feature provided that the Commercial Customer received notice of the additional cost prior to enhancement. 
    16.2.2.2 Franchise Fee. From the gross revenues collected for all Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service, FRANCHISEE shall be obligated to pay the CITY the Franchise Fee in the amount of ten percent (10%) of gross revenues collected in the immediately preceding month pursuant to the Franchise granted herein. For Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service, as services billed by the FRANCHISEE, the FRANCHISEE shall pay to the CITY the Franchise Fee on or before the thirtieth (30 th ) Day of each month. 
    16.2.2.3 Sanitation Service Charges. From the gross revenues collected for all Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service, FRANCHISEE shall be obligated to pay the CITY a Sanitation Service Charge collected from a Commercial Customer. For Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service, as services billed by the FRANCHISEE, the FRANCHISEE shall pay to the CITY the Sanitation Service Charges collected in the immediately preceding month pursuant to the Franchise granted herein. The Sanitation Service Charge shall be $0.33 per cubic yard of Solid Waste billed, other than Special Waste, per Commercial Customer and is not subject to an annual CPI adjustment. 
    16.2.2.4 Net Revenues. FRANCHISEE shall pay the Franchise Fee and the Sanitation Service Charges collected from Commercial Customers in the immediately preceding month pursuant to the Franchise granted herein and FRANCHISEE shall retain the Net Revenues. For purposes of this Section 16.2.2., Net Revenues shall refer to the Commercial Solid Waste Collection Services rate collected less the Franchise Fee and Sanitation Service Charges paid to the CITY. 
    16.2.3. Supplemental Recyclable Collection Service for Residential Units. 
    16.2.3.1 Rates. The customer rate for Supplemental Recyclable Collection Service for Residential Units, as defined in Section 6.7, is 30% of the Residential Rate provided in Exhibit "D" per Residential Unit, subject to CPI adjustment as set forth in Section 16.3 below, inclusive of Franchise Fees. The rate for Supplemental Recyclable Collection Service for Residential Units as set forth in this Agreement is the total rate that may be charged for said service. No additional fees or charges shall be billed by FRANCHISEE to the Commercial Customer for Supplemental Recyclable Collection Service for Residential Units. 
    16.2.3.2 Franchise Fee. From the gross revenues collected for all Supplemental Recyclable Collection Service for Residential Units, FRANCHISEE shall be obligated to pay the CITY the Franchise Fee in the amount of ten percent (10%) of gross revenues collected in the immediately preceding month pursuant to the Franchise granted herein. For Supplemental Recyclable Collection Service for Residential Units, as services billed by the FRANCHISEE, the FRANCHISEE shall pay to the CITY the Franchise Fee on or before the last calendar Day of each month. 
    16.2.3.3 Net Revenues. FRANCHISEE shall pay the Franchise Fee collected from Commercial Customers (receiving Supplemental Recyclable Collection Service for Residential Units) in the immediately preceding month pursuant to the Franchise granted herein and FRANCHISEE shall retain the Net Revenues. For purposes of this Section 16.2.3, Net Revenues shall refer to the Supplemental Recyclable Collection Service for Residential Units rate collected less the Franchise Fee paid to the CITY. 
    16.2.4. FRANCHISEE shall not separately state the amount of the Franchise Fee or the Sanitation Service Charge on any bill to any Commercial Customer. 
    16.2.5. The FRANCHISEE shall pay the Franchise Fee and the Sanitation Service Charges to the CITY on or before the thirtieth (30th) Day of each calendar month following the previous month's collection of invoiced accounts from the Commercial Customers. For example, from payments received from the Commercial Customers by the FRANCHISEE in September, FRANCHISEE shall pay the Franchise Fee and the Sanitation Service Charges based on September collections to the CITY by October 30. 
16.3 Adjustment to Rates and Billing Fees 
    16.3.1. CPI Adjustment for Residential Customers 
    16.3.1.1 Annual Rate Adjustment. On October 1, 2017 and every year thereafter, upon the direction of the FRANCHISEE, the rates for Residential Solid Waste Collection Service and Residential Recyclable Collection Service set forth in Section 16.1 above may be adjusted every year of the term of the Franchise Agreement. The annual adjustment of the rates charged to Residential customers shall be limited to an annual percentage of increase of the then current Consumer Price Index (CPI) in effect at time of adjustment subject to a 3% limitation. If the annual calculation results in an increase in the CPI, the Residential Unit rates will be adjusted upward accordingly but in no event shall the adjustment increase more three percent (3%) annually. The parties understand and agree that the Franchise Fee will reflect the CPI adjustment to rates. 
    16.3.1.2 Annual Billing Fee Adjustment. On October 1, 2017 and every year thereafter, upon the direction of the CITY, the Billing Fee for Residential Customers set forth in Section 16.1 above may be adjusted every year of the term of the Franchise Agreement. Similar to the annual rate adjustment set forth in Section 16.3.1.1 above, the annual adjustment of the Billing Fee shall be limited to an annual percentage of increase of the then current Consumer Price Index (CPI) in effect at time of adjustment subject to a 3% limitation. If the annual calculation results in an increase in the CPI, the Residential Customer Billing Fee will be adjusted upward accordingly but in no event shall the adjustment increase more three percent (3%) annually. 
    16.3.1.3 The FRANCHISEE shall provide the CITY with a schedule of supporting calculations for the rate adjustment, showing both the old rate and the new rate and the Billing Fee adjustment, showing both the old Billing Fee and the new Billing Fee. All rate adjustments are subject to review and confirmation of the calculations by the CITY. 
    16.3.2. CPI Adjustment for Commercial Rates. On October 1, 2017 and once every year thereafter, the FRANCHISEE may petition the CITY for to adjust the rates for Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service set forth in Section 16.2 above. FRANCHISEE may request an annual adjustment of the rates charged to Commercial Customers which adjustment shall not exceed an annual percentage of increase of the then current Consumer Price Index (CPI) in effect at time of adjustment subject to a 3% limitation. If the annual calculation results in an increase in the CPI, the FRANCHISEE may request that the rates for Commercial Solid Waste Collection Service will be adjusted upward accordingly but in no event shall the adjustment increase more three percent (3%) annually. The parties understand and agree that the Franchise Fee will reflect the CPI adjustment to rates. The Contractor shall provide the calculation for the requested increase or decrease and reasonably requested corroborating information. The CITY shall grant or deny the request within thirty (30) days of the request. The CITY shall not unreasonably deny the request provided the supporting information is provided to the CITY. 
    16.3.3. The October CPI adjustments are based on the CPI reported for the twelve-month period ending the preceding June. The CPI shall refer to the index numbers of retail commodity prices designated "CONSUMER PRICE INDEX, ALL URBAN CONSUMERS, U.S. CITY AVERAGE, ALL ITEMS" (1982-1984=100), not seasonally adjusted, prepared by the Bureau of Labor Statistics of the U.S. Department of Labor. The following example below from U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics illustrates the computation of a percent change. This format shall be used to calculate CPI adjustment: 
CPI for current period 238.343 Less CPI for previous period 238.638 Equals index point change 0.295 Divided by previous period CPI 238.343 Equals 0.0012 Result multiplied by 100 0.0012 × 100 Equals percent change 0.12%  
    16.3.4. FRANCHISEE may petition the CITY to increase the rates based upon unusual increases in the cost of doing business due to a Change in Law or for such other reasons outside the reasonable control of FRANCHISEE. A request for increase due to a Change in Law may be made at any time such change occurs. Any such request shall be supported by full documentation establishing the increase in operating costs and the reasons therefor. 
SECTION 17. - EMERGENCY SERVICES. 
17.1 Contingency Planning. Within seventy-two (72) hours of notification from the CITY to the FRANCHISEE of an anticipated event that would qualify as an Uncontrollable Force, FRANCHISEE shall make reasonable efforts to remove all Solid Waste placed at the designated Collection Points for Residential Customers at no additional cost to the Residential Customer or the CITY. 
17.2 Variance from Regular Collection. In the event of an Uncontrollable Force, the Contract Manager may grant FRANCHISEE a variance from regular routes and schedules upon request by FRANCHISEE in writing to the Contract Manager stating the basis of the request. If the basis of the variance request is the temporary closure of the Designated Facility, FRANCHISEE shall resume regular collection service upon re-opening of the Designated Facility. If the Designated Facility is in operation but the FRANCHISEE is unable to perform regular collection service due to the event, FRANCHISEE shall make its best effort to resume regular collection service as soon as possible. In such cases, FRANCHISEE shall make the CITY its highest priority and additional effort will be rendered to make up for missed collections. As soon as practicable after such event and in no event later than seventy-two hours after such event, FRANCHISEE shall advise the Contract Manager when it is anticipated that normal routes and schedules can be resumed. All of the vehicles normally used by FRANCHISEE in the Franchise Area shall be dedicated to the collection of Solid Waste in the Franchise Area during the emergency and any subsequent recovery periods. FRANCHISEE shall notify all customers of any change in schedule or disruption of collection service. At FRANCHISEE's sole cost, notification shall be in the form of an advertisement in Florida Today newspaper published for Brevard County. 
17.3 Franchisee Unable to Provide Contracted Services. In the event that FRANCHISEE is unable to provide adequate collection services during an emergency or other event involving an Uncontrollable Force, the CITY may hire other contractors to provide those services. In such case, the CITY reserves the right to charge FRANCHISEE for all costs and expenses that the CITY incurs while providing the services that FRANCHISEE is obligated to provide pursuant to the requirements of this Agreement. 
17.4 FRANCHISEE's Additional Workload. The clean-up from an Uncontrollable Force constituting a natural disaster or otherwise may require that FRANCHISEE hire additional equipment, employ additional personnel, or work existing personnel on overtime hours to provide the collection services set forth in this Agreement. For collection services arising from an Uncontrollable Force, FRANCHISEE shall not receive any extra compensation (i.e., above the normal compensation provided in this Agreement) to recover the costs of rental equipment, additional personnel, overtime hours, or other expenses. The parties understand and agree that the City has contracted with third parties for debris hauling in the event of a disaster eligible for grants under the Federal Emergency Management Administration's Public Assistance Program and that the scope of this section 17.4 presumes that the City will exercise the need for such third party debris hauling in good faith. 
SECTION 18. - PERFORMANCE. 
18.1 Performance Bond. 
    18.1.1. FRANCHISEE shall furnish a performance bond as security for the performance of this Agreement with the CITY within thirty (30) Days of the Effective Date. Said performance bond will be equal to one million dollars ($1,000,000). The premium for the performance bond described above shall be paid by FRANCHISEE. The performance bond shall be written by a surety company licensed to do business in the State of Florida with an A.M. Best Financial rating of A-VI or higher for the most current calendar year available. The surety or sureties shall be a company or companies satisfactory to the CITY. 
    18.1.2. Said bond shall be forfeited should FRANCHISEE: (i) Fail to comply with the requirements of this Agreement; or (ii) Take the benefit of any present or future insolvency status or make a general assignment for the benefit of creditors, or file a voluntary petition in bankruptcy or a petition or answer seeking an arrangement of reorganization or the readjustment of indebtedness under the federal bankruptcy laws or under any law or statute of the United States or any state thereof, or consent to the appointment of a receiver, trustee, or liquidator of all or substantially all of FRANCHISEE's property; or (iii) By an order or decree of a court to be adjudicated bankrupt; or (iv) Have an order or decree of a court entered approving a petition filed by any of FRANCHISEE's creditors seeking a reorganization or readjustment of FRANCHISEE's indebtedness under the federal bankruptcy laws or any law or statute of the United States or any state thereof, provided, however, that if any such judgment or order is vacated within sixty (60) Days after the entry thereof, any notice of cancellation shall be and become null, void, and of no effect. 
18.2 Administrative Charges 
    18.2.1. Late Payment. Payments from the FRANCHISEE to the CITY not received on or before the due date shall bear interest at one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month. Unless delay in payment is due to an Uncontrollable Force, payments received by the CITY more than thirty (30) Days after the due date shall be subject to an administrative fee of $500 for the first late payment; $1,500 for the second late payment; and $5,000 for the third late payment and each subsequent late payment. 
    18.2.2. The Contract Manager may assess the following liquidated damages as administrative charges pursuant to this Article[Section] on a monthly basis in connection with the Agreement: 
Performance Standard Violation Liquidated
